snippet: A lawsuit is reigniting an issue that roiled Congress after the government’s bailout of Wall Street: the use of valuable deductions known as net operating losses.
abstract: Indiana University economics professor Eric B Rasmusen files suit against Citigroup, accusing bank of utilizing federal tax credit during financial crisis to not pay $800 million in New York State taxes; bank says suit lacks merit.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit is reigniting an issue that roiled Congress after the government’s bailout of Wall Street: the use of valuable deductions known as net operating losses.

headline.main: Citigroup Accused of Improperly Avoiding $800 Million in New York State Taxes
headline.print_headline: Citigroup Accused of Skirting State Taxes
